result.markdown:
--- title: "Cluster long time series" author: Raphael Saldanha date: now --- This notebook aims to cluster the Brazilian municipalities considering dengue cases time-series similarities. ## Packages ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── ✔ dplyr 1.1.2 ✔ readr 2.1.4 ✔ forcats 1.0.0 ✔ stringr 1.5.0 ✔ ggplot2 3.4.2 ✔ tibble 3.2.1 ✔ lubridate 1.9.2 ✔ tidyr 1.3.0 ✔ purrr 1.0.1 ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() ℹ Use the conflicted package () to force all conflicts to become errors ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(lubridate) library(arrow) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'arrow' The following object is masked from 'package:lubridate': duration The following object is masked from 'package:utils': timestamp ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(timetk) library(dtwclust) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Loading required package: proxy Attaching package: 'proxy' The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': as.dist, dist The following object is masked from 'package:base': as.matrix Loading required package: dtw Loaded dtw v1.23-1. See ?dtw for help, citation("dtw") for use in publication. dtwclust: Setting random number generator to L'Ecuyer-CMRG (see RNGkind()). To read the included vignettes type: browseVignettes("dtwclust"). See news(package = "dtwclust") after package updates. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(kableExtra) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'kableExtra' The following object is masked from 'package:dplyr': group_rows ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(tictoc) ``` ::: ## Load data Load the aggregated data. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} dengue <- read_parquet("../dengue-data/parquet_aggregated/dengue_md.parquet") dim(dengue) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 16772737 3 ``` ::: ::: ### Prepare data The chunk bellow executes various steps to prepare the data for clustering. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tdengue <- dengue %>% # Filter out dates after 2020-01-01, as this year is not complete filter(date <= as.Date("2020-01-01")) %>% # Pad days with zero cases group_by(mun) %>% pad_by_time(date, .by = "day", .pad_value = 0, .start_date = min(dengue$date), .end_date = max(dengue$date)) %>% ungroup() %>% # Aggregate by week mutate( week = str_pad(epiweek(date), pad = 0, width = 2), year = year(date) ) %>% group_by(mun, year, week) %>% summarise(freq = sum(freq, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% ungroup() %>% # Keep only municipalities series with more than 100 cases total group_by(mun) %>% mutate(total = sum(freq, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% ungroup() %>% filter(total >= 100) %>% select(-total) %>% # Prepare time series arrange(mun) %>% pivot_wider(names_from = mun, values_from = freq) %>% select(-week) %>% t() %>% # Convert object tslist() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` `summarise()` has grouped output by 'mun', 'year'. You can override using the `.groups` argument. ``` ::: ::: ## Clustering Sequence of `k` groups to be used. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} k_seq <- 3:10 ``` ::: ### SBD method ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tic() clust <- tsclust( series = tdengue, type = "partitional", k = k_seq, distance = "sbd", seed = 13 ) toc() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 30.357 sec elapsed ``` ::: ::: ### Cluster Validity Indices (CVI) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} names(clust) <- paste0("k_", k_seq) res_cvi <- sapply(clust, cvi, type = "internal") %>% t() %>% as_tibble(rownames = "k") %>% arrange(-Sil) res_cvi %>% kbl() %>% kable_styling() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
k Sil SF CH DB DBstar D COP
k_4 0.0791379 0.2942586 306.7187 4.320184 5.211837 0.0233990 0.3677273
k_9 0.0692345 0.0706509 175.8912 4.509069 6.067606 0.0141304 0.3513956
k_7 0.0496968 0.1391306 195.6647 3.600487 4.740779 0.0181748 0.3502974
k_10 0.0459831 0.0883332 135.2412 3.542252 4.435284 0.0143742 0.3398674
k_5 0.0458740 0.2229537 232.7183 3.748572 5.009317 0.0270760 0.3632605
k_8 0.0425873 0.1217603 193.0773 3.450881 4.358744 0.0222442 0.3502011
k_6 0.0420105 0.2472877 252.7502 5.282233 6.591471 0.0254406 0.3569795
k_3 0.0353830 0.3659076 319.9928 5.148414 5.829406 0.0139628 0.3936799
````` ::: ::: ### Cluster with higher Silhouette statistic ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sel_clust <- clust[[res_cvi[[1,1]]]] ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(sel_clust) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](cluster_long_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(sel_clust, type = "centroids", lty = 1) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](cluster_long_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672} ::: :::
